string_table.string: To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.
Use your arrow keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.

search.slidetext: launch course launch course launch course welcome to the module on merchandising kpis this module is a tool for understanding the merchandising key performance indicators (kpis). launch course launch course launch course launch course

navigation tour the progress bar indicates the progress of each slide in the module. the menu button enables you to view the slides in the module and the status of completion of each slide. the < prev button enables you to move to the previous slide in the module. the next > button enables you to move to the next slide in the module. select the play/pause toggle button to play or pause a slide. select the replay button to view the slide again. the resources tab on the upper right corner gives you access to supplementary documents - glossary and examples. the volume button enables you to adjust the volume of the course. the glossary is a list of frequently used words and their meanings. the exit button closes the course. next prev click next > to move to the next screen.

course objectives by the end of this course, you should be able to: explain the following merchandising kpis in detail: turnover sales margin sell out rate (sor) stock turn quality of stock click next > to move to the next screen.

merchandising kpis the merchandising kpis are metrics that are used to measure the performance of an opco or a region. these are: turnover sales margin sell out rate (sor) stock turn quality of stock the end-of-season analysis is performed based on these kpis and performance is gauged against the allocated budget for the last year’s performance. click next > to move to the next screen.

what is turnover? equivalent to revenue total amount of money generated from sales for a specific period net sales as it includes: discounts deductions from returned merchandise revenue called the ‘top line because: it sits on top of the income statement. turnover click next > to move to the next screen.
quiz results data knowledge check click next > to move to the next screen.

incorrect not quite! try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect click the below link to review the topic: what is turnover? click next > to move to the next screen. that’s correct! well done! click next > to move to the next screen. knowledge check identify the statements as correct or incorrect definitions of turnover. drag and drop the statements to their respective boxes. it is turnover it is not turnover amount of money a company retains after incurring the direct costs amount of money a company retains after incurring the direct costs amount of money a company retains after incurring the direct costs revenue or the total amount of money generated from sales revenue or the total amount of money generated from sales revenue or the total amount of money generated from sales net sales that includes discounts and deductions from returned merchandise net sales that includes discounts and deductions from returned merchandise net sales that includes discounts and deductions from returned merchandise revenue which is typically called the ‘top line’ revenue which is typically called the ‘top line’ revenue which is typically called the ‘top line’ used to pay other costs or satisfy debt obligations used to pay other costs or satisfy debt obligations used to pay other costs or satisfy debt obligations submit submit submit submit submit

what is sor? sell out rate (sor) sales to date total quantity received to date sell out rate (sor): performance regardless of the season of purchase shows how well a collection or article is performing calculated at all levels from division/category down to article level denoted by a progressive percentage ratio click next > to move to the next screen.
summary the merchandising kpis are as follows: turnover sales margin sell out rate (sor) stock turn quality of stock the key takeaways from this course are: click next > to move to the next screen.

final assessment to complete the course, you must take the final assessment. the passing score on the assessment is 80 per cent. while taking the assessment, you will not be able to access any other part of the course. the assessment has 5 questions. you have unlimited attempts to take this assessment. begin assessment begin assessment begin assessment begin assessment

sales margin sales margin sales margin sales margin sales margin sales margin turnover turnover turnover turnover turnover turnover gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit sell out rate (sor) sell out rate (sor) sell out rate (sor) sell out rate (sor) sell out rate (sor) sell out rate (sor) assessment question 1 _____________ shows how well a collection or article is performing. select correct option and then click submit. submit submit submit submit submit

capital capital capital capital capital capital gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit gross profit turnover turnover turnover turnover turnover turnover stock stock stock stock stock stock assessment question 3 higher the sales margin, greater the ___________ a company retains. select correct option and then click submit. submit submit submit submit submit
